title: Retro Macrame Crafts
description: Knot by knot! How well do you remember the 1970s macrame craze that decorated every room?

questions.question: What is macrame primarily based on?
Which decade saw the biggest macrame craze in America?
What was the most popular macrame project that held potted plants at various heights?
What basic knot, forming a flat, square shape, is the most fundamental knot in macrame?
What spiral-shaped pattern is created by repeatedly tying half square knots in the same direction?
What type of cord or material was most commonly used for macrame projects in the 1970s?
options: Jute, cotton cord, or macrame cord

questions.question: What decorative macrame item was commonly hung on walls as art in 1970s homes?
What were wooden or plastic rings used for at the top of many macrame plant hangers?
options: As a starting point to gather and hang the cords

questions.question: What was often added to macrame projects for decoration, threaded onto the cords between knots?
What macrame accessory could hold a large glass bottle or jug, using knotted cord as a carrier?
options: A macrame bottle holder (or jug sling)

questions.question: What mounting knot was used to attach cords to a dowel or ring at the beginning of a project?
What item, hung in doorways as a room divider, was a trendy 1970s macrame project?
options: A macrame curtain or door hanging

questions.question: What personal accessory was a popular smaller macrame project, often worn as jewelry?
